result.execSummary:
The defendant John J. Thoms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: ** Court has no objection to discharge at six months if restitution is paid.  JOC amended on 10/17/2021.  BSoltow

miscConds.notes: Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 10/1/2021.
Defendant to author a sincere letter of apology to the victim and submit to District Attorney's Office for delivery.

Restitution Summary
Order and amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation cases.
to amend judgment of conviction
and stipulation to amend conviction

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Bennett.  DA Milanowski appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim appears by video.  Defendant made a substantial payment before court to the DA's Office, however did not pay in full.  Arguments made on sentencing by State and Defense.  R.A. makes statement.  Court withholds sentence and imposes 6 months probation.  Conditions of probation: Payment of restitution $314.42.  Restitution to be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Clerk to disburse to DA or Victim.  Defendant to author a sincere letter of apology to victim.  The letter will be delivered to the victim by the DA's Office.

Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed for public access purposes.  Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  DA Milanowski appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he has not received tax refund yet.  Court grants State's motion to revoke and enters judgment.  Sentencing hearing set August 2, 2021 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing on June 3, 2021 at 08:15 am.

Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed for public access purposes.  Defendant appears by telephone without counsel.  DA Milanowski appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he did file taxes on March 15, however has not received refund as of today's date.  He states he still intends to use tax return to pay restitution right when he receives it.  State notes his last payment was December of 2019. Court adjourns for one month. State notes that if restitution is not paid next set date, they will be motioning to revoke without further extensions.  Motion hearing set for June 3, 2021 at 8:30 am.  Bond Continued.

Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed for public access purposes.  Defendant appears by telephone without counsel.  ADA Niemi appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not gotten his tax return back yet, so restitution has not been paid.  The Court adjourns to May 3, 2021 at 11:30 am.

Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed for public access purposes.  Defendant appears by telephone without counsel.  DA Milanowski appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes restitution is not paid in full and request motion to revoke be granted.  Defendant states he is filing taxes for return and will be able to pay with that.  Court adjourns motion to revoke hearing to April 5, 2021 at 11:30.  Hearing may come off the calendar and order be submitted by the State if defendant pays restitution prior to hearing.

09:28 AM  Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed for public access purposes.  Attorney Martha Johanna Milanowski appeared by video means through Zoom for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Attempts to reach defendant John J. Thoms by phone means unsuccessful.  Court notes that the updated address defendant provided in October resulted in the Notice of Hearing mailed to be returned as undeliverable.  Judge notes that when the defendant was last before the court, he indicated that the balance of restitution owed would be paid through his wife's tax return.  DA Milanowski indicates that no additional money has been received towards restitution.  Bench warrant authorized:  $1,500.00 cash.
Notice of hearing
Motion hearing on March 1, 2021 at 09:00 am.

11:34 AM  Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed on YouTube Live for public access purposes. Defendant John J. Thoms appeared by phone means.  Attorney Martha Johanna Milanowski appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Before calling the case, defendant indicated that he has attempted to seek counsel without success.  Court speaks to DEJ and conditions of the agreement, primarily the restitution that was to be paid in full.  DA Milanowski notes that the balance is $1,387.00.  Defendant speaks indicating his wife is willing to have her tax return go to the restitution owed.  Court asks questions of defendant.  DA Milanowski indicates that this case has been adjourned many times with promises to pay.  She would like to go forward with revocation of the DEJ.  Court speaks.  Court will adjourn so that restitution can be paid through tax return as indicated by the defendant.  Next hearing will be to either confirm full payment of restitution or proceed to sentencing.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 1, 2021 at 09:00 am.

Motion hearing on November 13, 2020 at 11:30 am.

01:07 PM   Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed on YouTube Live for public access purposes. Defendant John J. Thoms in court, in custod without counsel.  DA Martha Johanna Milanowski appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he was told he didn't need to appear at last hearing and that his Attorney only needed to appear.  Court advised that Attorney Richards is no longer representing defendant on the matter and needs to requalify for a public defender.  State notes that if $1,387 in restitution is paid in full, problem would be resolved and motion to revoke would no longer be necessary.   Prior bond reinstated.  Motion to revoke set for November 13, 2020 at 11:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 13, 2020 at 11:30 am.
BODY ONLY

Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed on YouTube Live for public access purposes.  Defendant does not appears.  DA Milanowski appears by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion hearing notice served to defendant on 8/2/20.  Proof of service filed with the court.  Court authorizes bench warrant on non appearance - BODY ONLY.
for non appeeranace at motion hearing.  BODY ONLY.
Off record.  Service was not completed. New date provided for Motion to revoke, August 12, 2020 at 10:00 am.  DA to file amended motion.
Amended motion to revoke DEJ
Judicial Assistant contacted Attorney Waters to confirm method of appearance and he confirmed that he was never appointed on this case.  He was removed as counsel of record.

Defendant does not appear.  DA Milanowski appears for the State of Wisconsin via video.  Hearing is taking place via Zoom and live streamed on YouTube Live for public access purposes.  Restitution has not been paid.  Motion to revoke to be filed by the State.  Motion to revoke hearing set 7/7/2020 at 8:30 am.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Waters.  DA Milanowski appears for the State of Wisconsin. State agrees to extend DEJ to allow further time for restitution to be paid.  Firm date of 6/1/2020 for restitution to be paid, or motion to revoke will be filed.  Review hearing set for 6/1/2020 at 9:15 am.  Clerk of Court to contact previous attorney of record, Attorney Richards, and notify of review date.
Status hearing on December 11, 2019 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 9, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John J. Thoms in court with attorney Daryl R Waters.  Martha Johanna Milanowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resitution is still owed in matter.  State agrees to adjourn Motion to Reveoke DEJ to allow time for defendant to pay restitution.  Defendant states he will put his per cap towards restitution in November.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

Not on the record.  Defendant John J. Thoms not in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Revoke will be filed and served on defendant.  Motion hearing to be set for same date and time of Plea and Sentencing in 19CF11.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 22, 2019 at 11:00 am.
